IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CHRISTIAN SCHOOL TO PROVIDE EXCELLENCE IN COLLEGE PREPARATORY EDUCATION, AFFIRM THE GIFTS AND CHALLENGE THE POTENTIAL OF EACH STUDENT AND ENCOURAGE STUDENTS TO HONOR GOD THROUGH CHRIST-LIKE CHARACTOER
IRS990.MissionDesc: CHRISTIAN SCHOOL TO PROVIDE COLLEGE PREPARATORY EDUCATION AND ENCOURAGE STUDENTS TO HONOR GOD THROUGH CHRIST-LIKE CHARACTER
IRS990.Desc: EDUCATION: PRIVATE CHRISTIAN SCHOOL OFFERING FULL PRE K-12 PROGRAM FOR APPROXIMATELY 762 STUDENTS TUITION AND STUDENT HOUSING

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY PROGRAMS: OFFERING A WIDE ARRAY OF TEACHING PROGRAMS BEYOND THE CLASSROOM EXPERIENCE INCLUDING BOARDING HOUSE, FINE ARTS, ATHLETICS, AND THE AMERICAN FREEDOM MUSEUM

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ATHLETICS: EXTRA CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES FOR STUDENTS TO ENHANCE THEIR EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: In accordance with FASB ASC 740, Income Taxes, management has evaluated the Schools tax positions and concluded that the School has taken no uncertain tax positions that required adjustments to the financial statements to comply with the provisions of this guidance. The Schools tax returns are subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service, generally for three years from the date of filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COGS NETTED AGAINST ATHLETIC INCOME $78945 FUNDRAISING EXPENSES $89365

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A STATEMENT RELATED TO THE SCHOOL'S NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS PRESENTED IN ALL WRITTEN MATERIALS CONTAINING SCHOOL INFORMATION WHICH IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. THE NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS ALSO PRESENTED ON THE SCHOOL'S WEBSITE. THE SCHOOL'S WEBSITE CONTAINS WORDING RELATED TO THE NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY AND THE SCHOOL POSTS THE POLICY IN LOCAL NEWSPAPERS. THE POLICY STATES - "NOTICE OF NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY" - AS TO THE STUDENTS, THE BROOK HILL SCHOOL ADMITS STUDENTS OF ANY RACE, COLOR, NATIONAL AND ETHNIC ORIGIN AND ALL RIGHTS, PRIVILEGES, PROGRAMS, AND ACTIVITIES GENERALLY ACCORDED ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS AT THIS SCHOOL. IT DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, COLOR, NATIONAL AND ETHNIC ORIGIN IN ADMINISTRATION OF ITS EDUCATION POLICIES, ADMISSION POLICIES, SCHOLARSHIPS AND LOAN PROGRAM, AND ATHLETICS AND OTHER SCHOOL ADMINISTERED PROGRAMS."

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
Part I, Line 1b: Reason for not following policy regarding payment provisions for expenses
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD APPROVES BUDGET WHICH INCLUDED DISCRETIONARY SPENDING FOR HEAD OF SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: STEVE DEMENT IS THE PRESIDENT OF A REAL ESTATE TITLE COMPANY AND CHAIRMAN OF THE SCHOOL. SOME OF THE SCHOOL'S BOARD MEMBERS AND EMPLOYEES HAVE CLOSED REAL ESTATE TRANSACTIONS THROUGH THE REAL ESTATE TITLE COMPANY WHERE HE WORKS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE PROVIDED A COPY OF THE ANNUAL TAX RETURN AT THEIR MONTHLY MEETING AND APPROVE THE RETURN PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TRUSTEES AND VARIOUS KEY EMPLOYEES ARE ASKED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST PRIOR TO SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S CONTRACT IS ORIGINATED BY AN OUTSIDE SEARCH FIRM PROVIDING COMPARABLE DATA AND GUIDELINES FOR HIRING AND FUTURE SALARY INCREASES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS PROVIDED INFORMATION REGARDING THE REQUIREMENTS OF HIS POSITION, COMPARABLE DATA AND PERSONNEL QUALIFICATIONS TO SUPPORT THE SELECTION OF KEY EMPLOYEES WITH GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON WRITTEN REQUEST FROM THE PUBLIC - COPIES OF THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTERESTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND TAX RETURN ARE MAILED TO THE REQUESTING PARTIES.
